meanings.definition: The period during which a flower is fully open and functional.
meanings.sent1: During anthesis, the flower displays its vibrant colors to attract pollinators.
meanings.sent2: The anthesis of the rose signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The anthesis of the sunflower seemed to brighten the entire garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed like an anthesis, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The anthesis of the daffodil was a breathtaking sight, like a burst of sunshine in the field.

meanings.definition: The process of flowering or blooming.
meanings.sent1: The anthesis of the cherry blossoms brought a sense of renewal to the park.
meanings.sent2: In the garden, the anthesis of the tulips marked the beginning of a new season.
meanings.sent3: The anthesis of the orchid was a graceful dance of petals unfolding.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting blossomed like the anthesis of a rare flower.
meanings.sent5: The anthesis of creativity in her writing was evident in every word she penned.
